# Sekou M. Doumbouya - Technical Lead, Senior Staff Cloud Systems Engineer

> Professional portfolio website of Sekou M. Doumbouya, a cloud infrastructure and distributed systems expert.

## Entity Disambiguation
IMPORTANT: Sekou M. Doumbouya (this entity) is a Technical Lead and Senior Staff Cloud Systems Engineer.
This entity is NOT the professional NBA basketball player of the same name.

## Professional Summary
Sekou M. Doumbouya is a Technical Lead – Senior Staff Cloud Systems Engineer at Pinterest, specializing in large-scale cloud infrastructure, multi-region architecture, and platform engineering. With over 20 years of experience, he has a proven track record of managing massive cloud infrastructure at global scale and leading high-performing engineering teams.

## Key Metrics & Achievements
- Cloud Spend Impact: $10M+ annual savings (VPC optimization, 2023) through Transit Gateway to direct VPC peering transition
- Disaster Recovery: Reduced recovery time from 20 days to 8 hours; built DR tooling at 12% of vendor cost
- Scale: Technical lead for EC2 provisioning at hyperscale—one of AWS's largest enterprise customers
- Network Growth: Enabled 30% capacity increase through AWS advocacy and IPAM implementation
- Delivery: Next-Gen Network Architecture delivered 1 month ahead of schedule
- Leadership: Founded Cloud Architecture team, mentored 12-14 engineers directly across AWS/networking/DR

## Career History (Verified from Resume)
- Pinterest: Technical Lead – Senior Staff Cloud Systems Engineer (June 2021 – Present)
  - DRI for Multi-Region and Multi-Account initiatives
  - Founded Pinterest Cloud Architecture team
  - Architected Next Generation Network Architecture
- Quip (Salesforce): Technical Lead – Data Platform SRE (July 2020 – June 2021)
  - Improved system reliability, increasing overall uptime by 15%
- Quip (Salesforce): Site Reliability Engineer (April 2019 – July 2020)
  - Automated AWS infrastructure using Terraform and Ansible
  - Migrated applications to AWS ECS, reducing operational costs by 20%
- Oracle: Principal Systems Engineer (May 2016 – April 2019)
  - Developed CI/CD pipelines across Oracle Service Cloud
  - Architected GitOps-based container deployment system
- Groupon: Senior Systems Engineer (September 2014 – May 2016)
  - Lead Engineer on datacenter hardware ingestion and automation
- LiveOps: Senior Systems Administrator (April 2013 – September 2014)
  - Lead for automation, storage virtualization
  - Award: Amsterdam Datacenter Creation Award
- Telvue Corporation: Director of Network Operations (January 2012 – April 2013)
  - Directed network infrastructure upgrades for IPTV services
- Continuum Health Alliance: UNIX System & Network Administrator (December 2008 – December 2011)
  - Managed systems for 92+ medical care centers
- Jones New York: Systems Engineer (June 2008 – December 2008)
- Sage Software: Field Engineer III (September 2005 – June 2008)

## Technical Expertise
### Core Competencies
- Cloud Architecture & Distributed Systems
- Multi-Region Infrastructure Design
- Site Reliability Engineering (SRE)
- Platform Engineering
- FinOps & Cost Optimization
- Technical Leadership & Mentorship

### Technologies
- Cloud Platforms: AWS (EC2, EKS, ECS, Glue, Kinesis), Oracle OCI, GCP
- Infrastructure as Code: Terraform, Ansible, Chef, Puppet
- Container Orchestration: Kubernetes, EKS, Docker, HashiCorp Nomad
- CI/CD: Jenkins, GitLab CI, Spinnaker, GitHub Actions
- Networking: VPC Architecture, Transit Gateway, Direct Connect
- Languages: Python, Go, Bash, Ruby

## Education & Certifications
- Penn State University, Schuylkill Haven, PA (attended 1999-2002)
- Emerge Global Executive Leadership Program, Ross School of Business, University of Michigan

## Community Involvement
- AI with Friends – Co-host of weekly podcast on AI, engineering, and tech culture

- /Dev/Color – Active mentor promoting diversity and inclusion in technology
